issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares Ride.getName() as returning char[] (+getName(): char[]) while the Ride attribute is declared as name: String. The reference solution implements getName() returning String. This mismatch between the UML return type and the attribute type/solution can mislead students about the intended getter signature and cause them to implement the wrong return type.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the UML in the problem statement so the getter return type matches the declared attribute type and the intended implementation. Change +getName(): char[] to +getName(): String (or, alternatively, change the name attribute to char[] everywhere if that was intended). Preferably update problem_statement.md (UML) to +getName(): String so students and tests are consistent with the reference solution.
